source.content: <DL> <!-- Handle the case with no DD or DT --> <DT>One</DT> <DD>One Def</DD> <DT>Two</DT> <DD>Two Def</DD> <DT>Three</DT> </DL>

Do not:

  • talk,
  • eat, or
  • use your mobile telephone
while you are in the cinema.
<foo baz="Q"> <bar baz="3" bop="T"/> <foo baz="1"/> <bar bop="S" bip="4" baz="5"/> </foo>

test-case.name: for-each-group-001
test-case.description: simple test of value-based grouping

test-case.name: for-each-group-002a
test-case.description: Error case: bind-group and bind-grouping-key variables no longer permitted

modified.change: turn this into an error case (spec has changed)
Correct error code for XSLT20. See bug 25305

test-case.name: for-each-group-002
test-case.description: Error case: bind-group and bind-grouping-key variables no longer permitted

modified.change: turn this into an error case (spec has changed)

test-case.name: for-each-group-003
test-case.description: test value-based grouping, sorting both the groups and the items within each group

test-case.name: for-each-group-005
test-case.description: test value-based grouping using a sort-key that depends on the whole group

test-case.name: for-each-group-007
test-case.description: test value-based grouping with explicit use of the codepoint collation

test-case.name: for-each-group-009
test-case.description: grouping used to arrange data in columns in a table

test-case.name: for-each-group-011
test-case.description: Grouping used to arrange data in columns in a table Doesn't yet handle the &nbsp for missing cell

test-case.name: for-each-group-012
test-case.description: test distinct-values on string values

test-case.name: for-each-group-013
test-case.description: test distinct-values on numeric values

test-case.name: for-each-group-014
test-case.description: test for-each-group in "pull" mode

test-case.name: for-each-group-015a
test-case.description: Nesting positional grouping inside value-based grouping - bug 18333

test-case.name: for-each-group-015b
test-case.description: Nesting positional grouping inside value-based grouping - bug 18333

test-case.name: for-each-group-016
test-case.description: simple test of positional grouping using group-starting-with

test-case.name: for-each-group-018
test-case.description: nested groups using group-starting-with

test-case.name: for-each-group-020
test-case.description: use case for group-starting-with to structure DT/DD style glossary

test-case.name: for-each-group-022
test-case.description: Use case for group-adjacent to structure a DT/DD style glossary

result.assert-xml:
• One, TwoOne and Two Def
  • One
    1. One Def
    2. Another One Def

test-case.name: for-each-group-024
test-case.description: Use group-adjacent to merge a set of adjacent bullets under an envelope element

result.assert-xml:
Do not:

  • talk,
  • eat, or
  • use your mobile telephone

while you are in the cinema.

test-case.name: for-each-group-026
test-case.description: Use case for multilevel grouping to do a hierarchic inversion

test-case.name: for-each-group-027
test-case.description: grouping used to find all the element names and attribute names in a document

test-case.name: for-each-group-028
test-case.description:
positional grouping to turn
separators into elements

test-case.name: for-each-group-029
test-case.description: use case for grouping to merge an update file with a base file

source.content: <employees> <employee SSN="1000" name="John"/> <employee SSN="1001" name="Jane"/> <employee SSN="1002" name="Jim"/> <employee SSN="1003" name="Joan"/> <employee SSN="1004" name="Jan"/> </employees>

result.assert-xml: <out><employee SSN="1000" name="John"/><employee SSN="1001" name="Jane" /><employee SSN="1002" name="Jim B"/><employee SSN="1003" name="Joan B"/><employee SSN="1004" name="Jan B" /><employee SSN="1005" name="Janet B"/><employee SSN="1006" name="Joanna B"/></out>

test-case.name: for-each-group-030
test-case.description: test group-ending-with to merge continuation records

test-case.name: for-each-group-031
test-case.description: A contrived test to ensure that variables - specifically, a variable that's subject to optimization - can be handled in a for-each-group pattern

test-case.name: for-each-group-032
test-case.description: Demonstrate group-by using a numeric key (mixing different numeric types)

result.assert-xml: <o><group pop="7"><city name="milan" country="italy" pop="5" /><city name="paris" country="france" pop="7" /><city name="munich" country="germany" pop="4" /><city name="lyon" country="france" pop="2" /><city name="manchester" country="england" pop="7.0" /><city name="liverpool" country="england" pop="7" /><city name="venice" country="italy" pop="1"/></group ><group pop="10"><city name="london" country="england" pop="10" /></group><group pop="5"><city name="bristol" country="england" pop="5.0" /><city name="sheffield" country="england" pop="05"/></group></o>

test-case.name: for-each-group-033
test-case.description: Test group-by where an item goes in more than one group

test-case.name: for-each-group-034
test-case.description: test that distinct-values treats NaNs as equal

test-case.name: for-each-group-035
test-case.description: test that distinct-values works on a heterogeneous sequence

test-case.name: for-each-group-036
test-case.description: Test position() and last() with the result of distinct-values()

test-case.name: for-each-group-037
test-case.description: Test position() and last() with the result of xsl:for-each-group group-by

test-case.name: for-each-group-038
test-case.description: Test position() and last() with the result of xsl:for-each-group group-adjacent

test-case.name: for-each-group-039
test-case.description: Test position() and last() with the result of xsl:for-each-group group-starting-with

test-case.name: for-each-group-040
test-case.description: Test position() and last() with the result of xsl:for-each-group group-ending-with

test-case.name: for-each-group-041
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using pattern to match atomic values

modified.change: Replaced tilda pattern syntax to new syntax .[. instance of type].

test-case.name: for-each-group-042
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using pattern to match atomic values

test-case.name: for-each-group-043
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using group-by with composite keys

test-case.name: for-each-group-044
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using group-adjacent with composite keys

test-case.name: for-each-group-045
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using group-adjacent with composite keys including NaNs

test-case.name: for-each-group-046
test-case.description: Demonstrate error in 2.0 when using group-starting-with when population contains atomic values

test-case.name: for-each-group-046a
test-case.description: Demonstrate non-error in 3.0 when using group-starting-with when population contains atomic values

test-case.name: for-each-group-047
test-case.description: ERR XTSE1060: it is a static error if the current-group() function is used within a pattern

test-case.name: for-each-group-048
test-case.description: ERR XTSE1070: it is a static error if the current-grouping-key() function is used within a pattern

test-case.name: for-each-group-049
test-case.description: ERR XTSE1080: it is a static error if none of the four grouping attributes is present

test-case.name: for-each-group-050
test-case.description: ERR XTSE1080: it is a static error if more than one of the four grouping attributes is present

test-case.name: for-each-group-051
test-case.description: ERR XTSE1090: cannot specify collation except with group-by/adjacent

test-case.name: for-each-group-052
test-case.description: ERR XTTE1100: group-adjacent selects an empty sequence

test-case.name: for-each-group-053
test-case.description: stable attribute only allowed on first xsl:sort

test-case.name: for-each-group-054
test-case.description: invalid value for stable attribute

test-case.name: for-each-group-055
test-case.description: In 3.0, current-group() is initially absent

test-case.name: for-each-group-056
test-case.description: In 3.0, current-grouping-key() is initially absent

test-case.name: for-each-group-059
test-case.description: In 3.0, group variable is not visible within AVTs of a contained xsl:sort

test-case.name: for-each-group-060
test-case.description: In 3.0, grouping key variable is not visible within AVTs of a contained xsl:sort

test-case.name: for-each-group-061
test-case.description: Demonstrate group-by using times in different time zones

test-case.name: for-each-group-062
test-case.description: Demonstrate group-adjacent using times in different time zones

test-case.name: for-each-group-063
test-case.description: Demonstrate items belonging to zero or more groups, including one that has the same grouping key repeated

test-case.name: for-each-group-064
test-case.description: Demonstrate non-error when mixing different data types in group-by

test-case.name: for-each-group-065
test-case.description: Demonstrate non-error when mixing different data types in group-adjacent

test-case.name: for-each-group-066
test-case.description: tests current(), position() and last() within xsl:for-each-group

test-case.name: for-each-group-067
test-case.description: an interesting use case for group-adjacent, used to identify consecutive items that are not equal, but contiguous in value

test-case.name: for-each-group-068
test-case.description: Example of non-Transitivity from Erratum E25

test-case.name: for-each-group-069
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using group-by with variable length composite keys

result.assert-xml: <out><element path="a" count="1"/><element path="a/b" count="3"/><element path="a/b/c" count="4"/><element path="a/b/c/d" count="2"/></out>

test-case.name: for-each-group-070
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using group-adjacent with variable length composite keys

test-case.name: for-each-group-071
test-case.description: XSLT 2.0 grouping, group-starting-with pattern refers to a function parameter

test-case.name: for-each-group-072
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping, group-by with composite="yes"

result.assert-xml: <out ><group key="3 blue" key.count="2" group.size="3" /><group key="1 blue" key.count="2" group.size="1" /><group key="2 blue" key.count="2" group.size="1" /><group key="1 red" key.count="2" group.size="1" /><group key="2 red" key.count="2" group.size="1" /><group key="3 red" key.count="2" group.size="2" /></out>

test-case.description: simple test of value-based grouping, with composite="no"

test-case.description: simple test of value-based grouping, with composite=" false " (with white-space)

test-case.name: for-each-group-075
test-case.description: simple test of value-based grouping, with composite="0"

test-case.name: for-each-group-076
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using group-by with composite=" " (not allowed).

test-case.description: A dynamic call on current-group() is a dynamic error

test-case.description: A dynamic call on current-group() is a dynamic error

test-case.description: A dynamic call on current-grouping-key() is a dynamic error

test-case.name: for-each-group-079b
test-case.description: A dynamic call on current-grouping-key() is a dynamic error

test-case.description: Value of last() when processing groups

source.content: <root> <items> <item key="a" value="a1"/> <item key="b" value="b1"/> <item key="a" value="a2"/> <item key="c" value="c1"/> <item key="a" value="a3"/> <item key="c" value="c2"/> </items> </root>

test-case.description: current-group() when absent - differs between 2.0 and 3.0

test-case.name: for-each-group-081b
test-case.description: current-group() when absent - differs between 2.0 and 3.0

test-case.name: for-each-group-082
test-case.description: group elements by local-name

result.assert-xml: <out ><group><line att="1"/><line att="2"/><line att="4"/><line att="7"/><line att="8"/><line att="11"/></group ><group><line2 att="3"/></group ><group><line3 att="5"/><line3 att="6"/><line3 att="9"/><line3 att="10"/></group ><group><a:line xmlns:a="http://example.com" att="12"/><a:line xmlns:a="http://example.com" att="13"/><b:line xmlns:b="http://example.com" att="16"/></group ><group><a:line3 xmlns:a="http://example.com" att="14"/><b:line3 xmlns:b="http://example.com" att="15"/></group></out>

test-case.name: for-each-group-083
test-case.description: A random example from StackOverflow

test-case.name: for-each-group-084
test-case.description: Call on last() within for-each-group/@group-starting-with

all-of.assert: /result/local/variable-def/para/text = "is an estimate of the border processing costs for the levy period, as adjusted under subclause (2)"

test-case.name: for-each-group-085
test-case.description: reference to current-group() within a variable

test-case.name: for-each-group-086
test-case.description: Test position() and last() with the result of xsl:for-each-group group-adjacent with a case-blind collation (modification of for-each-group-038)

modified.change: drop unnecessary and undocumented DTD dependency

test-case.name: for-each-group-087
test-case.description: XSLT 3.0 grouping using group-by with composite keys and a case-blind collation (modification of for-each-group-043)

modified.change: drop unnecessary and undocumented DTD dependency

test-case.name: for-each-group-088
test-case.description: Reference current-group() in for-each-group/@select

test-case.name: for-each-group-089
test-case.description: group elements by local-name, while retaining accumulator values and dropping namespace declarations

result.assert-xml: <out><line att="1" accumulator="1"/><line att="2" accumulator="3" /><line att="4" accumulator="10"/><line att="7" accumulator="28" /><line att="8" accumulator="36"/><line att="11" accumulator="66" /><line2 att="3" accumulator="6"/><line3 att="5" accumulator="15" /><line3 att="6" accumulator="21"/><line3 att="9" accumulator="45" /><line3 att="10" accumulator="55" /><a:line xmlns:a="http://example.com" att="12" accumulator="78" /><a:line xmlns:a="http://example.com" att="13" accumulator="91" /><b:line xmlns:b="http://example.com" att="16" accumulator="136" /><a:line3 xmlns:a="http://example.com" att="14" accumulator="105" /><b:line3 xmlns:b="http://example.com" att="15" accumulator="120"/></out>

test-case.name: for-each-group-090
test-case.description: Dynamic function call on current-group#0 (see Â§5.3 in XSLT 3.0 spec)
